page.title: 05The Gravel Pits, Hampton
page.content: The{Gravel Pits}are situated next to the River Blythe down Marsh Lane. Some people, like myself, went swimming there until a sign was put up saying, "No persons are allowed to use these premises without special permission". Many people like walking around the lakes, as this is allowed. There are two{lakes}which both have islands. The one nearer to the road is the smaller and deeper of the two. The pits were dug out by Martin Conelly Contractors. It took twelve men three to four years to finish digging out all the gravel. The lakes cover thirty acres and the gravel which they dug out weighed thousands of tonnes. There are some working{sand}and {gravel}pits along Cornets End Lane. These have expanded rapidly over the last few years and now occupy a very large area of land.
